meanings.definition: The act of admitting or allowing entry.
meanings.sent1: The immittance of guests into the party was smooth and orderly.
meanings.sent2: The immittance fee for the museum was affordable for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The immittance of the mischievous raccoon into the house caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The immittance of fresh ideas into the discussion sparked creativity among the team.
meanings.sent5: The immittance of sunlight through the window brightened up the room instantly.

meanings.definition: The state of being admitted or allowed entry.
meanings.sent1: Her immittance into the exclusive club was a dream come true.
meanings.sent2: The immittance of new students into the school brought a sense of excitement.
meanings.sent3: The immittance of the stray cat into the house made the children ecstatic.
meanings.sent4: The immittance of positive energy into the room lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The immittance of fresh air into the stuffy room was a relief for everyone present.
